YbPm7CA05KzlRRum9317.title: Security today: change your habbits and make it safer and efficient
YbPm7CA05KzlRRum9317.description:
Security is often a large pain for dev team, a strange set of shady 
ceremonials complicated to relate to proper scientific facts, slowing 
down software delivery and flowing the users experience. This talk will 
explain why and discuss a new mindset on security to make it safe and 
efficient.
Description
‚ÄúThis is for obvious security reasons‚Äù, how many time your IT project
 have been delayed because of this so called security reasons that you 
never understand? Sometimes because of the holly network policy (that 
implied answering to shady excel sheet) or the publisher restriction 
(that you never see, but it exists, like the lady of the lake) and all 
of this process made for mysterious security stuff that make your work 
sad and inefficient. There is an historic reason for all of this‚Ä¶
But the all computer science have evolved, and security need to fits 
to today needs. But more, the all economy around security and threat 
have changed, and it‚Äôs important to understand how to see security as 
opportunity cost, and how to de-valuate the economic interest of the 
target you are representing. This way, there is a possible evaluation of
 the security management.
So, in this talk, we will explain the reasons of this sad situation, 
and more important move to modern software and infrastructure security 
principles, based on what we do at Clever Cloud since 10 years, this 
presentation is made to provide a new mindset over security principles, 
and a new framework to be efficient on modern IT with new threat, new 
contexts and new tools.
So, Can security stop to be managed like voodoo by shamans and become a technical scientific approach?

Les vilains pirates et les grufalos affam√©s ne peuvent donc plus espionner et voler les clefs du tr√©sor, et la recette math√©magique simplifie grandement le travail des valeureux d√©veloppeurs et administrateurs. Si √† travers cette modeste histoire nous faisons connaitre SRP et participons √† son adoption, alors c'est la fin du game pour les pirates √† chapeau noir et les gigantesques grufalos (ou presque).

Secure Remote Protocol est un protocole d'authentification par mot de passe reposant sur une preuve √† divulgation nulle de connaissance (Zero-Knowledge Proof). Il a √©t√© publi√© en 1998 par Tom Wu, de l'universit√© de Stanford, puis standardis√© en 2000 dans la RFC 2945. Il est notamment utilis√© au quotidien par les millions d'utilisateurs de ProtonMail.
